com.valentine.esp

Class ValentineClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.valentine.esp.ValentineClient

  • public class ValentineClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class that handles all the interfacing with the Valentine One. All the calls to the device are done through this class. It will wrap all the handling and unpacking of packets and handling the registering and deregistering for packets leaving the user to use the data structures in the data package to handle the data. Only create one instance of this class at a time, so do not create multiple instances of this class. Put this in your application class and save the instance there.

      Int result code that indicates the connection attempt was initiated, with delay.
      static int RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_FAILED_LE_NOT_SUPPORTED
      Int result code that indicates the connection attempt was not initiated because the device does not support Bluetooth LE (Low Energy).
      static int RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_FAILED_NO_CALLBACK
      Int result code that indicates the connection attempt was not initiated because no callback was provided.
      static int RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_FAILED_NO_DEVICE
      Int result code that indicates the connection attempt was not initiated because there a valid BluetoothDevice wasn't passed in.
      static int RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_FAILED_UNSUPPORTED_CONNTYPE
      Int result code that indicates the connection attempt was not initiated because the ConnectionType passed-in is not supported.
      static int RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_NO_CONNECTION_ATTEMPT
      Int result code that indicates the connection attempt was not initiated.

      • scanForDevices

        public boolean scanForDevices(ConnectionType connectionType,
                     VRScanCallback scanCallback,
                     int secondsToScan)
        Initiates a Bluetooth discovery for the specified ConnectionType for 'x' seconds. Discovered BluetoothDevices are delivered to VRScanCallback.onDeviceFound(BluetoothDeviceBundle, ConnectionType).
        Parameters:
        connectionType - The connection type of the bluetooth discovery. Valid values are ConnectionType.V1Connection, ConnectionType.V1Connection_LE
        scanCallback - The callback that will receive the bluetooth devices, and the scan complete notification.
        secondsToScan - The time length to perform the bluetooth scan.
        Returns:
        True if the bluetooth discovery process was started.

      • abortConnectionSync

        public void abortConnectionSync()
        Deprecated. DO NOT USE. THIS METHOD WILL BE REMOVED IN THE NEXT API RELEASE.
        This will synchronously disconnect the connected V1Connection and shutdown the Processing thread. This effectively shuts down the ESP Library. (DO NOT CALL FROM UI THREAD)

      • startUpSync

        public boolean startUpSync(BluetoothDevice deviceToConnect)
        Deprecated. DO NOT USE. THIS METHOD WILL BE REMOVED IN THE NEXT API RELEASE.
        Synchronously connect to deviceToConnect using the SPP protocol. This method will block until a connection has been made or an exception occurs. Calling this thread on the UI thread will throw a Runtime exception. (DO NOT CALL FROM UI THREAD)
        Parameters:
        deviceToConnect - The V1Connection to connect.
        Returns:
        True if a bluetooth connection was made with deviceToConnect. If deviceToConnect is null, returns false immediately.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if called from the UI (Main) Thread

      • startUpAsync

        public int startUpAsync(BluetoothDevice deviceToConnect,
               ConnectionType connectionType,
               java.lang.String callbackMethod,
               java.lang.Object callbackOwner)
        Asynchronously connects to deviceToConnect using the specified connectionType. This method is asynchronous and will return immediately with the result of the connection attempt. Once the connection event completes, the callbackOwners' callbackMethod will be invoked with a boolean result of the current connection state. True for connected, false for anything else. (Safe to call from the UI thread)
        Parameters:
        deviceToConnect - The V1Connection to connect.
        connectionType - The protocol to use when initiating the connection with deviceToConnect.
        callbackMethod - The name of the method inside of the callbackOwner that will receive handle the connection result. Must accept a boolean parameter. Not allowed to be null.
        callbackOwner - The object that will receive handle the connection result. Not allowed to be null.
        Returns:
        Int constants that indicates the result of the connection attempt. Valid return values are = { RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_NO_CONNECTION_ATTEMPT, RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_FAILED_NO_DEVICE, RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_FAILED_LE_NOT_SUPPORTED, RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_FAILED_NO_CALLBACK, RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_FAILED_UNSUPPORTED_CONNTYPE, RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_CONNECTING, RESULT_OF_CONNECTION_EVENT_CONNECTING_DELAY }

      • onConnectionEventCallback

        public void onConnectionEventCallback(java.lang.Boolean isConnected)
        Callback that will receive the connection event from the ValentineESP object. **(DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY, SHOULD ONLY BE CALLED VALENTINEESP)**
        Parameters:
        isConnected - A flag that indicates if the connection event resulted in a bluetooth connection.

      • ShutdownSync

        public void ShutdownSync()
        Deprecated. DO NOT USE. THIS METHOD WILL BE REMOVED IN THE NEXT API RELEASE.
        Synchronously disconnects from the V1Connection if connected and shuts down the ESP Library. (DO NOT CALL FROM UI THREAD)
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if called from the UI (Main) Thread

      • ShutdownAsync

        public void ShutdownAsync(java.lang.String callbackMethod,
                 java.lang.Object callbackOwner)
        Asynchronously disconnect from the V1Connection if connected and shuts down the ESP Library. This will effectively shut down the ESP Library. (Safe to call from the UI thread)
        Parameters:
        callbackMethod - The name of the method inside of the callbackOwner that will receive handle the disconnection result. Null is allowed.
        callbackOwner - The object that will receive handle the disconnection result. Null is allowed.

      • onDisconnectionEventCallback

        public void onDisconnectionEventCallback()
        Callback that will receive the connection event from the ValentineESP object. **(DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY, SHOULD ONLY BE CALLED VALENTINEESP)**

      • isLibraryInDemoMode

        public boolean isLibraryInDemoMode()
        Checks to see if the library is in 'Demo' mode.
        Returns:
        True if the library is running in Demo mode otherwise, false.

      • setProtectLegacyMode

        public void setProtectLegacyMode(boolean val)
        Set method to determine if the ESP library should protect legacy mode. If this value is true when the V1 is running in Legacy mode, the write thread will not send any commands that are not compatible with Legacy Mode. The only commands that are compatible with Legacy Mode is a V1 mute request and a version request to the V1connection. If this value is false, the write thread will send all commands to all devices. This value is defaulted to false to make it compatible with older versions of this library.
        Parameters:
        val - The new value of this setting.

      • getProtectLegacyMode

        public boolean getProtectLegacyMode()
        Get the current state of Legacy Mode protection provided by the ESP library. Refer to setProtectLegacyMode for more information on this feature.
        Returns:
        The current state of Legacy Mode protection provided by the ESP library.

      • doSearchCallback

        public void doSearchCallback(InfDisplayData _resp)
        This is the Callback registered with the system to determine which of the Valentine One types we have. This is updated each time we get a InfDisplayData packet response.
        Parameters:
        _resp - The display data to tell us what type of Valentine One we have.

      • registerStopNotification

        public void registerStopNotification(java.lang.Object _stopObject,
                            java.lang.String _stopFunction)
        This registers an object/function combination to be notified when the ESP client stops. Only one allowed at a time Requires a function with a Void parameter: public void function( Void _parameter).
        Parameters:
        _stopObject - Object with the function to be called
        _stopFunction - Function to be called

      • deregisterStopNotification

        public void deregisterStopNotification(java.lang.Object _stopObject)
        Removes the registered stop notification callback information.
        Parameters:
        _stopObject - The object to deregister for stop notifications.

      • handleStopNotification

        public void handleStopNotification(java.lang.Boolean _rc)
        This is the call back from the ESP client to call. Don't call this directly.
        Parameters:
        _rc - A Boolean value that is always true.

      • registerForDisplayData

        public void registerForDisplayData(java.lang.Object _callbackObject,
                          java.lang.String _function)
        Registers a callback to handle InfDisplayInfoData data structures from the Valentine One. Many can be registered. Requires a function with a InfDisplayInfoData parameter: public void function( InfDisplayInfoData _parameter).
        Parameters:
        _callbackObject - Object with the function to be called.
        _function - Function on the object to be called.

      • registerForAlertData

        public void registerForAlertData(java.lang.Object _callbackObject,
                        java.lang.String _function)
        Registers a callback to handle an ArrayList of AlertData data structures from the Valentine One. One can be registered. Does not start the flow of the alert data, that requires a call to sendAlertData. Requires a function with a ArrayList parameter: public void function( ArrayList _parameter).
        Parameters:
        _callbackObject - Object with the function to be called.
        _function - Function on the object to be called.

      • infDisplayCallback

        public void infDisplayCallback(InfDisplayData _resp)
        This is the callback from the ESP client to handle InfDisplayData coming from the Valentine One, it converts the response packet into InfDisplayInfoData data and sends that on to the list of registered functions. Do not call this directly.
        Parameters:
        _resp - The InfDisplayData packet from the Valentine One.

      • deregisterForDisplayData

        public void deregisterForDisplayData(java.lang.Object _source)
        Removes the callback for the given object so it will no longer receive InfDisplayInfoData data structures to process.
        Parameters:
        _source - The object which to stop getting InfDisplayInfoData from.

      • deregisterForAlertData

        public void deregisterForAlertData(java.lang.Object _originalCallbackObject)
        Stops the processing of the alert data from the Valentine One.
        Parameters:
        _originalCallbackObject - The object that you would like to unregister for AlertData events.

      • getVersion

        public void getVersion(java.lang.Object _callbackObject,
              java.lang.String _function,
              Devices _destination)
        Gets the version of the requested device. Don't use this one for getting the Valentine One version, use the getV1Version call instead. Requires a function with a String parameter: public void function( String _parameter).
        Parameters:
        _callbackObject - The object that has the function on it to be notified when it has the version of the device.
        _function - The function to call when the version is available.
        _destination - The device to query for its version.

      • getV1Version

        Parameters:
        _callbackObject - The object that has the function on it to be notified when it has the version of the Valentine One.
        _function - The function to call when the version is available.

      • mute

        public void mute(boolean _onOff)
        Mutes the Valentine one. True turns the muting on.
        Parameters:
        _onOff - True Mutes the device.

      • turnMainDisplayOnOff

        public void turnMainDisplayOnOff(boolean _onOff)
        Turns off and on the main display on the Valentine One. True is on, false is off.
        Parameters:
        _onOff - True is on, false is off/

      • sendAlertData

        public void sendAlertData(boolean _send)
        Turns off and on the flow of Alert Data from the Valentine One. To process this data, use registerForAlertData to register a callback to process the data.
        Parameters:
        _send - True starts the data, false stops the data.

        _device - The device to send a RequestFactoryDefault to.

      • getAllSweeps

        public void getAllSweeps(java.lang.Object _callbackObject,
                java.lang.String _function)

        Parameters:
        _callbackObject - The object which has the function to call when the sweeps are available.
        _function - The function to call when the sweeps are available.

      • getAllSweeps

        public void getAllSweeps(boolean _clearCache,
                java.lang.Object _callbackObject,
                java.lang.String _function)
        Requests current set sweeps on the Valentine One. Requires a function with a ArrayList parameter: public void function( ArrayList _parameter).
        Parameters:
        _clearCache - if true, the sweep data cache will be cleared before the sweep data is read.
        _callbackObject - The object which has the function to call when the sweeps are available.
        _function - The function to call when the sweeps are available.

      • abortSweepRequest

        public void abortSweepRequest()
        This method will force the stop the sweep reading state machine.

      • setCustomSweeps

        public void setCustomSweeps(java.util.ArrayList<SweepDefinition> _definitions,
                   java.lang.Object _callbackObject,
                   java.lang.String _function,
                   java.lang.Object _errorObject,
                   java.lang.String _errorFunction)
        Write the supplied custom sweep definitions to the Valentine One. This does not do any checking of the definitions before writing them to the device. Both the success callback and the error call back require a function with a String parameter: public void function( String _parameter).
        Parameters:
        _definitions - A list of definitions for the sweeps.
        _callbackObject - The object that has the function to call when the sweeps are written correctly.
        _function - The function to call on success.
        _errorObject - The object that has the function to call when the sweeps writing fails.
        _errorFunction - The function to call on failure.

        Parameters:

      • getSweepSectionsCallback

        public void getSweepSectionsCallback(ResponseSweepSections _resp)
        This is the call back from the ESP client to call to handle the RequestSweepSections packets. Do not call directly.
        Parameters:

      • startDemoMode

        public void startDemoMode(java.lang.String _demoData,
                 boolean _repeat)
        Starts the ESP Library in demo mode. This will disconnect the client from a connected V1Connection.
        Parameters:
        _demoData - The demo data of bytes from packets, comments, and display messages read into a single string from a file.
        _repeat - Repeat the data from the beginning when it reaches the end of the data.

      • stopDemoMode

        public boolean stopDemoMode(boolean _restart)
        Exit's the ESP Library from Demo mode, with the option to attempt a connection with the last V1Connection.
        Parameters:
        _restart - If true, the ESP Library will attempt to connect with the last V1Connection once demo Mode is exited. The connection attempt will be performed synchronously, not safe to perform on the UI thread.
        Returns:
        Returns true, if @param _restart is true, the return value will indicate if a Bluetooth connection was established with the V1Connection.

      • registerNotificationFunction

        public void registerNotificationFunction(java.lang.Object _notificationObject,
                                java.lang.String _function)
        Registers a function to handle notification messages from the Demo mode data playback. Requires a function with a String parameter: public void function( String _parameter). Only one Notification callback is allowed at a time, registering a second will overwrite the first.
        Parameters:
        _notificationObject - The object that handles the notification and has the function on it.
        _function - The function to be called.

      • deregisterNotificationFunction

        public void deregisterNotificationFunction()
        Removes the notification callback data.

      • doNotification

        public void doNotification(java.lang.String _notification)
        Performs the notification callback to the registered notification object. This should never be called from outside of the ESP Library.
        Parameters:
        _notification - The notification to be handled by the notification object.

      • changeMode

        public void changeMode(byte _mode)
        Changes the logic mode of the Valentine One.
        Parameters:
        _mode - The value of the mode you want to set the valentine one to. 
         Value    Mode
          US                      Euro Non Custom Sweeps      Euro Custom Sweeps 
 1        All Bogeys              K & Ka(Photo)               K & Ka Custom Sweeps
 2        Logic Mode              Ka(Photo Only)              Ka Custom Sweeps
 3        Advanced Logic Mode     n/a                         n/a

      • clearVersionCallbacks

        public void clearVersionCallbacks()
        Utility function that will clear all callbacks for the Request Version packets. This is to clear outstanding callbacks if a device is not connected when an activity is dismissed.

      • clearAllCallbacks

        public void clearAllCallbacks()
        Utility function that will clear all callbacks for all packets types. This is to clear outstanding callbacks if a device is not connected when an activity is dismissed.

      • registerNoDataCallback

        public void registerNoDataCallback(java.lang.Object _owner,
                          java.lang.String _function)
        Register a function to be notified if the ESP client has not received any data from the Valentine One after X seconds. Example case of this being called, the valentine one has been turned off for more than X seconds. Requires a function with a String parameter: public void function( String _parameter). Only one Notification callback is allowed at a time, registering a second will overwrite the first.
        Parameters:
        _owner - The object with the function to be notified when there is no data from the Valentine One.
        _function - The function to call.

      • deregisterNoDataCallback

        public void deregisterNoDataCallback()
        Removes the no data notification callback.

      • setDemoConfigurationCallbackData

        public void setDemoConfigurationCallbackData(java.lang.Object _owner,
                                    java.lang.String _function)
        Sets the callback data for when the demo data processing finds a User Settings packet in it. Requires a function with a UserSettings parameter: public void function( UserSettings _parameter).
        Parameters:
        _owner - Object to be notified when there is a demo data user settings object in the demo data.
        _function - Function to be called.

      • getDemoUserSettings

        public UserSettings getDemoUserSettings()
        Returns the current UserSettings from the demo data outside of the callback.
        Returns:
        the demo data user settings.

        _function - The function to be called.

      • isRegisteredForPacket

                            java.lang.Object _object)

        Parameters:
        _type - - The packet type to look for.
        _object - - The object to look for.
        Returns:
        true if the object passed in is registered for the packet type passed in, else false.
